oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Assessing Epidemiologic Risk of the Quantity of Bovine Viral Diarrhea Virus found to be Associated with in vivo-derived Bovine Embryos
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gard, J. A.
Givens, M. D.
Galik, P. K.
Stringfellow, D. A.
Riddell, K. P.
Marley, S. E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bovine viral diarrhea virus
BVDV
vivo-derived
vitro-produced
embryos
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bovine viral diarrhea virus (BVDV) has been shown to be associated with single transferable in vivo-derived and in vitro-produced bovine embryos despite washing. However, a thorough risk assessment of the potential for transmission of BVDV via transfer of in vivo-derived embryos has not been undertaken. Hence, the primary objective of this study was to evaluate the potential of BVDV to be transmitted during the transfer of in vivo-derived embryos.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2008; 257
